I've downloaded the latest Heritrix src tar.gz onto my Linux box.  I'm
usin=
g Maven 2.05, Sun's JDK1.6, and the Heritrix1.10.2-src.  When I
type "mvn /=
path/to/heritrix-src" I get the Mavin error: 

-
[INFO] Invalid task '/home=
/user/Desktop/heritrix-1.10.2/': you must
specify a valid lifecycle phase, =
or a goal in the format plugin:goal
or pluginGroupId:pluginArtifactId:plugi=
nVersion:goal
-

Does anyone know what causes this?

Also, under the same s=
etup, I've tried to use the
cmdline-jmxclient-0.15.5.jar on the binary heri=
trix1.10.2.  And while
"java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar - localhost:=
8849"
works pefectly, if I try 
"java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar - l=
ocalhost:8849
org.archive.crawler:name=3DHeritrix,type=3DService"
I get 
-
=
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.ar=
chive.jmx.Client.doBeans(Client.java:332)
        at org.archive.jmx.Client=
.execute(Client.java:312)
        at org.archive.jmx.Client.execute(Client.=
java:278)
        at org.archive.jmx.Client.execute(Client.java:256)
      =
  at org.archive.jmx.Client.main(Client.java:159)
-

Anyone know what cause=
s this?

Other than that, Heritrix is working wonderfully.  I've managed to=

write a JMX client that can fully manage Heritrix from a remote
client.  A=
nd once I figure out how to build Heritrix with Mavin (see
first issue), I =
will attempt to write some specialized modules.  But
I'm a Perl programmer =
who is unfamiliar with the intracies of Java
builds/tools, so I forsee a st=
ruggle.

But Heritrix is one of the coolest projects I've ran into in a lon=
g
time.  Great work everyone who contributed!
